hero.title: Clear tools and consulting for AI.
hero.subtitle: We design simple, accessible tools and offer pilot consulting starting in 2026. Products are in development.

highlights.title: What you get
highlights.item_1_body: NodeVoyage and Ideonautix are in development to help with travel and creative work.
highlights.item_2_body: Lesson plans and workshops that are easy to use and share.
highlights.item_3_body: Pilot sprints with clear documentation and opt-out controls.
highlights.item_4_body: Simple guides and events for families, students, and founders.

offer.title: What we offer
offer.consulting_body: We map use cases, run pilot sprints, and train your team.
offer.consulting_bullet_1: Automation roadmaps and workflow design tuned to your daily operations.
offer.consulting_bullet_2: Pilot sprints with measurable outcomes, documentation, and opt-out controls.
offer.consulting_bullet_3: Training that hands ownership back to your team once the sprint completes.
offer.products_body: NodeVoyage and Ideonautix share the same accessible design system.
offer.products_bullet_1: NodeVoyage: an AI-assisted travel planner with collaborative tools and sustainability tracking.
offer.products_bullet_2: Ideonautix: Pomodoro Coach, Pitch Assistant, and Competitive Intelligence modules for founders.
offer.products_bullet_3: Shared AI orchestration, accessibility tokens, and localisation for six languages from day one.
offer.education_body: Classroom kits and workshops. Simple to adapt and localize.
offer.education_bullet_1: Teacher programmes spanning basics to leadership, with resources in plain language.
offer.education_bullet_2: Targets: 80% of Latvian institutions reached, 25k+ students yearly, 500+ trained teachers.
offer.education_bullet_3: Partnership model with LIAA for events, curriculum input, and long-term measurement.

brand.section_copy: Everything starts with honest execution and calm communication.

overview.title: Who we are
overview.copy: AlgoRhythmics is a Latvia-based, pre-company stage initiative building accessible AI tools and practical consulting. We speak plainly about our in-development status and work with partners who value real execution.
overview.bullet_1: Mission: unlock useful AI for everyday people, schools, startups, and small businesses.
overview.bullet_2: Operating from Daugavpils and Riga with a remote-first mindset and a co-leadership model.
overview.bullet_3: Rooted in Reclame Fabriek’s Signage Research Department for real-world R&D discipline.

pillars.title: Three pillars, one rhythm
pillars.copy: Products, consulting, and education move together so partners see impact fast.
pillars.bullet_1: NodeVoyage travel OS and Ideonautix founder toolkit are in active build.
pillars.bullet_2: Consulting sprints map automation, integrate AI safely, and train teams to own the outputs.
pillars.bullet_3: Education programmes with LIAA align classroom pilots, teacher training, and community events.

impact.title: Why this matters
impact.copy: Accessible AI only works if it stays calm, inclusive, and measurable. That is our baseline.
impact.bullet_1: Useful AI tools that explain themselves and respect autonomy.
impact.bullet_2: Structured programmes with measurable outcomes for schools and cultural partners.
impact.bullet_3: Focused startup support that removes noise and protects time.
impact.bullet_4: Fair, local-friendly pricing that scales outward with proof.

blueprint.title: How we build
blueprint.lead: Our stack combines signage-grade reliability with modern product cadence. Every layer tracks accessibility, privacy, and documentation.

frontend.title: Frontend
frontend.item_1: SvelteKit + TypeScript with WCAG 2.2 AA/AAA coverage, responsive layouts, and light/dark modes.
frontend.item_2: Multilingual interface (EN/LV/RU/UK/FR/ES) using shared tokens and calm motion defaults.

backend.title: Backend & Cloud
backend.item_1: Google Cloud stack (Cloud Run, Cloud SQL/Postgres, Firestore, Storage, Redis) with Fastify APIs and Prisma.
backend.item_2: OpenAPI-first contracts, CI/CD pipelines, and observability baked in.

ai.title: AI Layer
ai.item_1: Vertex AI as primary, OpenAI as fallback, with on-device models when privacy matters.
ai.item_2: Explainable prompts, opt-out controls, and clear audit trails for every decision.

realtime.title: Realtime & Quality
realtime.item_1: WebSockets and SSE for collaboration, plus testing from unit to accessibility checks.
realtime.item_2: CI pipelines mirror signage QA discipline with scenario scripts and visual diffing.

security.title: Security & privacy
security.item_1: GDPR-first, encryption everywhere, role-based access, and monitoring for every release.

pricing.title: Pricing & growth
pricing.lead: Latvia-first pricing keeps entry points between one and three euros. Education discounts stay non-negotiable.
pricing.bullet_1: NodeVoyage and Ideonautix launch with free tiers and €2.99/month premium, plus family and student options.
pricing.bullet_2: Marketing focuses on schools, students, and startup communities with transparent KPIs.
pricing.bullet_3: Risk scenarios include pricing flexibility, education partnerships, and staged expansion to the wider EU.

hero.title: Calm AI with signage-grade discipline
hero.subtitle: AlgoRhythmics is a Latvia-born studio co-led by founders who split their time between our products and Reclame Fabriek’s Signage Research Department.
hero.description: We blend signage R&D, accessible design, and honest communication. NodeVoyage and Ideonautix are in development, backed by real fabrication work on next-gen LED neon, in-house controllers, custom coatings, and 3D printed components in Daugavpils.

story.heading: Our story
story.intro: AlgoRhythmics began as a Riga side project and now bridges signage innovation, education pilots, and accessible AI tools. We stay transparent about the in-development stage while serving real partners.

milestones.0: Shaped the NodeVoyage and Ideonautix roadmaps around Latvian schools, founders, and families using feedback loops from the Education, Product, and Consulting pillars.
milestones.1: Tested calm AI rituals with Reclame Fabriek colleagues, ensuring signage-floor precision and safety translate into consumer software.
milestones.2: Outlined funding sprints that keep pricing inclusive (EUR 1–3 entries) and education-first metrics at the centre of every release.

story.culture: Our internal rhythm alternates between fabrication labs, usability sessions, and quiet research sprints. We document everything in plain language so collaborators, schools, and investors stay in sync.

values.title: What keeps us moving
values.copy: Clear language, measurable impact, and inclusive experiences are non-negotiable.

education_first.title: Education first
education_first.copy: We nurture AI literacy in classrooms and community hubs. Free resources and respectful mentorship keep curiosity alive for every learner.

empowerment.title: Empowerment through technology
empowerment.copy: Whether you are a founder, teacher, or student, our tools are designed to feel welcoming, intuitive, and human-centred.

integrity.title: Innovation with integrity
integrity.copy: Ethical guardrails, privacy, and transparency guide every release. We document automation decisions in plain language so trust stays intact.

community.title: Community & collaboration
community.copy: Partnerships with parents, cultural institutions, and industry mentors turn AI into a shared dance rather than a solo act.

team.title: Meet the team
team.copy: We operate as a 50/50 co-leadership duo balancing signage research with calm AI delivery.

nikita.name: Nikita Jurtaevs
nikita.focus: Strategy, product direction, and partner delivery
nikita.bio: Nikita Jurtaevs serves as CEO in a 50/50 co-leadership model, guiding brand, partnerships, and product UX/QA across NodeVoyage and Ideonautix while contributing to Reclame Fabriek’s Signage Research Department.
nikita.highlight_1: Leads accessible, multilingual delivery plans with LIAA-aligned pilots and a 2025–2026 go-to-market timeline for both platforms.
nikita.highlight_2: Works on next-gen LED neon systems, in-house LED controllers, custom coatings, and full-scale 3D printed components inside Reclame Fabriek R&D.
nikita.highlight_3: Keeps messaging honest: AlgoRhythmics is in development while the founders remain hands-on in Reclame Fabriek’s innovation arm.

slaff.name: Vjaceslavs “Slaff” Trosins
slaff.focus: Technical vision, AI platforms, and delivery
slaff.bio: Vjaceslavs “Slaff” Trosins co-leads AlgoRhythmics as CTO, owning the technical roadmap across web, mobile, APIs, and AI while engineering signage controllers at Reclame Fabriek’s Signage Research Department.
slaff.highlight_1: Designs Google Cloud-first architecture with SvelteKit/TypeScript, Fastify, Prisma, PostgreSQL, Redis/BullMQ, and Vertex AI or Gemini integrations.
slaff.highlight_2: Pairs Reclame Fabriek R&D experience on LED controllers and fabrication pipelines with explainable AI and real-time UX patterns in consumer software.
slaff.highlight_3: Oversees near-term funding sprints—Pomodoro Coach, Startup Pitch Assistant, and Competitive Intelligence Dashboard—to finance broader product build-out and hiring.

finale.title: Join the rhythm
finale.copy: We welcome collaborators who care about accessible technology, joyful learning, and responsible automation. Whether you are exploring careers, partnerships, or sponsorships, let’s build together.
